sen.j: 錦織家（にしごりけ）は卜部氏の流れを汲む堂上家。
sen.e: Nishigori family was a toshoke (the hereditary lineage of court nobles allowed to enter the tenjonoma in the palace) in the line of the Urabe clan.
The Nishigori family was a toshoke (within the hereditary lineage of court nobles allowed to enter the tenjonoma in the palace) down line of the Urabe clan.
The Nishigori family was a toshoke (within the hereditary lineage of court nobles allowed to enter the tenjonoma in the palace) down line of the Urabe clan.

sen.j: 萩原員従（正三位）（1645年 - 1710年）の次男錦織従久（従二位・弾正台）（1697年ー1755年）を祖とする。
sen.e: The founder of the family was Tsuguhisa NISHIGORI (Junii (Junior Second Rank), danjodai (Board of Censors)) (1697-1755) who was the second son of Kazutsugu HAGIWARA (Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank))(1645-1710)..

The founder of the family was Tsuguhisa NISHIGORI (Junii - Junior Second Rank), danjodai (Board of Censors) (1697-1755) the second son of Kazutsugu HAGIWARA (Shosanmi - Senior Third Rank) (1645-1710)..

The founder of the family was Tsuguhisa NISHIGORI (Junii - Junior Second Rank), danjodai (Board of Censors) (1697-1755) the second son of Kazutsugu HAGIWARA (Shosanmi - Senior Third Rank) (1645-1710).
sen.cmt: 文末のピリオド一つ削除

sen.e: The family status was hanke (lowest rank for toshoke)(noble).
The family status was hanke (lowest rank for toshoke) (noble).
The family status was hanke (a kind of family status of the Court nobles) (kuge [court noble]).

sen.j: 正三位・非参議を極官とする。
sen.e: Kyokkan (the highest rank to which one can be appointed) was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).
Kyokkan (the highest rank to which one can be appointed) was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).
Kyokkan (the highest rank to which one can be appointed) was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).

sen.j: 錦織久隆（1820年 - 1882年）は廷臣八十八卿列参事件に関わる。
sen.e: Hisataka NISHIGORI (1820-1882) was involved in the teishin hachiju-hachi kyo ressan jiken (demonstration of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court)
Hisataka NISHIGORI (1820-1882) was involved in the teishin hachiju-hachi kyo ressan jiken (demonstration of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court)
Hisataka NISHIGORI (1820-1882) was involved in the teishin hachiju-hachi kyo ressan jiken (demonstration of 88 retainers of Imperial Court)
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 30 koku (approx. 5.4 cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was thirty koku (approx. 5.4 cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 30 koku (approx. 5.4 cubic meters).
Since the Meiji Period, viscount
Since the Meiji Period, they held the title viscount.
Since the Meiji Period, they held the title viscount.
